item.title: Flytipped furniture, 18th July
item.description:
The tree/railings / pavement seen in the enclosed photo ( currently displaying a newly abandoned grey domestic armchair - adjacent to the traffic calming bollards in Newent Close is used on a constant basis by the local community as a place to abandon all of their unwanted household goods/waste. You name it and they've criminally dumped it. Your excellent road fly tip team clearly arrive weekly to pick up everything that these locals are happy to fly tip on an almost daily basis. I often cycle past and see that your hard working team have removed that week's detritus. Then I cycle past , even just a few hours later , and yet again there's a slew of fly tipped waste. This has been ongoing for years now to the extent the flytippers must assume this is actually a legitimate place for them to dump their unwanted household rubbish/ furniture/ clothing you name it. Is it at all possible to serveill that area with cameras and a warning notice to miscreants that they face prosecution for this anti social crime? Or perhaps write to the locals about the illegitimacy of the roadside being used as a free dump for their unwanted household items? I do my best to pick up the endless litter people drop in Peckham Grove/ Newent Close and Tower Mill Road - my belief is the less litter there is then the less people might litter themselves. The ongoing fly tipping however is beyond my capabilities. It's a total eyesore, remaining there over entire weekends/ weeks until your long suffering team of professionals turn up and whisk it away for free! Another point to note is that once one piece of rubbish is fly tipped it's soon attracts more!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 52, Peckham Grove, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unpaid for garden waste, 18th July
item.description:
This waste has been in place for at least 12 weeks. It has become a site for further dumping of rubbish and some of the waste has now taken root beside the tree. There is further duping of rubbish outside number 1 Wilderton Road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wilderton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish, pucker needed, 18th July
item.description:
